2164.subject: BUS
2164.descrlong:
An intensive experience in designing a startup business.  Participants will develop skills in teamwork and presentation and learn tools for designing a startup business or social enterprise, including business models, prototyping, market validation and feasibility, and pitching the business.  In addition to class meetings, the course requires participation in Startup Weekend (typically the first weekend of the semester) and two additional Friday half-day sessions.  (Offered in Spring)

[Prereq: BUS 310 and (Junior or Senior Standing)]
